page.title: 02HOUSING IN BULKINGTON
page.content: The 54 houses are mostly red brick and line the main street. Several have stone coins. The older brick came from Caen Hill brick works, Devizes. 4 farm houses remain and 4 pairs of farm cottages, several others having been converted to owner occupied single properties.The council owns 2 pairs of cottages; the other houses are owner occupied and mostly detached. There are 6 bungalows, l timber framed Tudor house and 1 thatched cottage. 13 have been built in the last 20 yrs, 6 are being built now, with planning permission granted for another 17 (14 of them on Campbell-Grays land - this has caused some local concern). The 6 houses presently under construction are of the 'executive' type with prices ranging up to over Â£110,000. The 125yr old stone church has 1 bell; services are held most Sundays.
